name: v1.5.1
body:
v1.5.0 was actually pretty buggy and so I had to write this in a really relaxed hurry.

These were added:
- Automatic grid count for grid layout
- Separate action between 'open app list' and 'open drawer' (#87)
- New and updated translations!

These were fixed:
- Favourites panel not showing when pinning apps
- Jumpy settings animation
- Widget resizes not updating
- Search bar text bunching up together under some circumstances
- Icons can be hidden in the 'hidden apps' list (this is a bug, not a feature)
- Crash when retrieving badged icons without permission
- Some NullPointerException in widget-space
- A really weird NumberFormatException when parsing serial number of a user
- Possibly the issue reported in #99 (would need further checking)

Under the hood stuff:
- User serial number will now be appended regardless of API
- Rearrange settings layout
- A lot of refactoring, especially with app loading
- Credits files are now loaded asynchronously (I think)

If what's written above wasn't clear, **this is** a bug-fixing release. Let's make a good foundation before we add more features into this train wreck.

(I also added back the MD5 and SHA256 sums because a lot of you were complaining before.)

name: v1.5.0
body:
Featuring my brand new album: The 11 Months Delay.

This release is one of the biggest the launcher had so far. The launcher has been rewritten to Kotlin, which started since e97f3b05e37d9290040f37e0eae1c4786a6f13a1. It has received some design overhauls and most importantly, I try my best to make this year-long wait worth it.

There isn't too much features introduced here. The big leap from 1.4 to 1.5 (wow) was made because HgLauncher is now using Kotlin as a whole. *Please don't expect big new changes*. Consider this a maintenance release because I've been slacking on my technical debts.

That said, here are some new stuff:
- Lots of new translations (there is too many to even mention!). You can take a look at everyone that has contributed [right here](https://github.com/F4uzan/HgLauncher/blob/c164fad448e218ccef2cc21afce0a7ac6735ed44/app/src/main/assets/translators.txt)
- Full-scale accent theming; the accent settings in the launcher now applies a launcher-wide colour change
- Revamped several UI elements here and there. Try and see if you can find them all
- Brand new grid mode! (#5)
- Widget-space receives its own space. Swipe left to see its new home! (This can be disabled if you like apps list all alone)
- You can now resize widgets. Long-press a widget to access its size slider
- Better fuzzy search algorithm. You can get even more wacky with your searches now
- Support for status bar hiding in Android 4.0
- Icon pack mask support
- Much faster app loading times
- Hg is now running on even fewer permissions! (a total of three permissions)
- Shinier 'Credits' section for all the worthy contributors (read: all of you)

Here are some bugs that got fixed:
- #25: Pinned apps should correctly display the app menu
- Fixed a lot of reliability issues with the search bar
- Crash fixes for widget-space
- Widget-space will now stop removing widgets randomly
- New/removed/disabled apps should be detected a lot better now (even if these apps exist in a foreign profile)
- Using wallpaper shading should no longer impose too much performance cost
- Fixed many foreign profile issues (icon loading, pinning, etc.)
- Widgets interactions (i.e through scrolling) have been fixed

And here are some things that got applied under-the-hood:
- Android 11 support, complete with the new keyboard control call and system bar visibility changes
- View binding!
- Full coroutine rewrite for most AsyncTask calls. This should greatly improve performance and stability when loading apps
- Delegated apps list to its own fragment, allowing it to exist right beside widget-space
- Faster widget loading for widget-space
- Improved package changes detection
- Package changes are applied selectively now, instead of brute-forcing a brand new list
- Fully entrust our backup/restore to SAF, don't request for storage permission above API 18

name: v1.4.2.3
body:
I can't believe I actually managed to hold the launcher in a seven months stalemate.

- We now have translations for Indonesian (@MikuDroid), Italian (@giupardeb), Czech (@PaperMountainStudio), and Portuguese (@mansil). Existing translations have been updated too.
- Implemented support for Work/Foreign profile.
- Added support for SAF and system-wide dark theme (this also includes battery-saver controlled theme as well).
- More customisation: accent switching for the desktop and customisable app list background.
- Material Design 2, not ala carte though.
- Fixed an issue with icon packs (#53).
- Probably more. It's been seven months, I don't remember much.

Real sorry to everyone that stayed with the launcher. I wish this didn't outright kill you.

name: v1.4.2.2
body:
We've got translations and we've got bug fixes!

- Added translation for Serbian (@pavlepiramida), Norwegian Bokmål (@comradekingu), and German (@fynngodau)
- Implemented a start screen for new users
- Added 'clear all' to the search bar (@macdonaldster)
- Search bar text can now be persisted in the launcher (@macdonaldster)
- Shorthands should be setting correctly when in search
- Keyboard (soft or otherwise) can launch web search directly when there is no app result
- Single tap and swipe down gesture should be able to launch apps now

It's not a big-ish release, but that's up for v1.4.3 to decide.

name: v1.4.2.1
body:
I waited for a week for more bugs to show. They don't seem to do so; therefore, new release.

- Fixed various issues with the search bar and the favourites panel.
- Made double tap gesture more reliable; it will now only fire one time as opposed to a dozen.
- Updated Basque and Spanish translation.

Let's hope no big issue appear again.

name: v1.4.2
body:
I don't know why I decided to put this on hold for so long, but here it is.

- Changed a few colours here and there.
- Gestures have been completely reworked. You can remap just about every direction available now, and more actions have been added in.
- Settings screens are now organised better than ever.
- Overhauled favourites panel animation to make it less choppy.

It's more than a bugfix™

name: v1.4.1.3
body:
A slightly more exciting maintenance release.

- Added translations for Polish by @adam5525, and Spanish by @beriain.
- Updated Basque translation.
- Fixed issues regarding search bar visibility when resuming the launcher activity.
- Optimised memory use, fixed leaks where possible.

Vacation's over. It's back to working out the issues again.

name: v1.4.1.2
body:
This is the first time the launcher receives two hotfix in a row.

- Fixed crashing in settings due to invalid drawable reference.
- Code optimisations.

Very exciting.

name: v1.4.1.1
body: A very quick update that sorts out SecurityException with app shortcuts. Nothing else here apart from the slightly better-ish icon.

name: v1.4.1
body:
Another weekly bug-fix (or rather, back to our usual schedule).

- Support for app shortcuts in Android 7.1+ — apps like Clock, Contacts, and the likes will now show shortcuts to various parts of the app if you access their long-pressed 'Shortcut' menu. This is app-dependent!
- Fixed crashing caused by reordering pinned apps. (#20)
- Restoring backups should no longer crash if you have widgets. Backup _may_ not at all restore the widgets, however.
- Online search prompt/strip should no longer disappear when the user taps on suggestions on their keyboard.
- Black theme is now actually black, as opposed to off-grey.

And now we go back to our week-long hibernation!

name: v1.4.0
body:
One month worth update, culminated into a single, hopefully-not-buggy release.

- Super shiny new icon from the designs of @tebriz159. (#15)
- Implemented shorthands based off of the suggestion in #11 and #16. Shorthands is a second name (or tag, anything you want) that can be used to search for the app.
- Web search providers can be modified; add them, edit them, delete them, go wild.
- Widgets support is extended. Multiple widgets can be added, and widgets have their own home. Some widgets still appear weirdly; that is up for the future commit to finish. (#12)
- More gestures action! You can now do swipe up, double-tap, as well as a swipe-down gesture to expand status bar.
- Added 'hide status bar' option for ICS & Jellybean. (Completion of #4)
- Added Basque translation (incomplete for now; may need updating) courtesy of @beriain. (#13)
- Lots and lots of fixes.

Feels proud to see that long list of changes.

name: v1.3.6.1
body:
A tad more than a bug fix, I think.

- Added an option for the app list to stay open. (#7)
- Trying to fix hidden apps issues with Huawei/EMUI 8.0 device(s). (#8)
- Minor UI changes in hidden app settings. (#8)
- Fixed minor web search issue.

Maybe I should get translations up next time.

name: v1.3.6
body:
Hooray, a release that does more than a bug fix!

- Added the ability to re-order pinned apps.
- Implemented gestures control: now you can launch apps with a swipe left/right on the desktop.
- Fixes for pinned apps icon when the pinned app shares package name with another activity.
- Sorted out inconsistency issues with launcher's smooth slide animation.
- Probably some more bug fixes here and there.

Next release should have an influx of bug fixes.

name: v1.3.5.5
body:
Bug fixes? Bug fixes.

- Improved launcher settings. It no longer uses the outdated material-preferences library, and instead leverages Google's preference-v7 for greater and better compatibility.
- Fixed issues with inconsistent preferences application.
- Sorted out issues with fast scroller crashing all over.
- Code optimisations.

I guess that's about it.

name: v1.3.5.4
body:
The previous bug fix is buggy, I found lots of bugs, then I fix them. It's Wednesday as usual, folks!

Changes:
* Fixed crashing when excluded app list is empty/when the launcher is first run.
* Fixed disappearing 'restore all' menu.
* Improved performance when changing preferences in settings.
* App installation/uninstallation listener should be working again now.

This is a quick retcon, yeah.

name: v1.3.5.3
body:
These two weeks have been not at all eventful. So, here, a bug fix.

Changes:
* Fixed hanging/freezing Settings when rapidly switching between themes.
* Improved widgets support: now widgets can be interacted!
* Reduced memory usage for some use-cases.
* Other fixes and improvements.

And that's about it!

name: v1.3.5.2
body:
I had this pushed to Play Store, but for some reason GitHub went down last evening. So here it is; super late and super totally a bug fix.

Changes:
* Super experimental widgets support. It's still half-baked and you can't interact with widgets yet, but if this piques your interest then you can enable it by using the testing menu.
* Overhauled hidden apps implementation. Now it works for multiple launch intents for the same apps.
* Fixed some minor UX issues.

I don't know what happened to GitHub yesterday, but I'm sure it's not a good one.

name: v1.3.5.1
body:
A bug fix dedicated to fixing issues _actually_ reported to me, instead of discovered by my own stupidity.

Changes in this release:
* Sorted a race condition between loading pinned apps and icon pack.
* Fixed an issue where scrolling is still viable when the panel is moving up.
* Fixed broken 'uninstall' menu in Android P.
* Prevent user from searching apps if the app list hasn't been loaded.

Have I said 'fixed' enough?

name: v1.3.5
body:
Apparently by my definition, 'big features implementation' meant an even bigger bug fixes. No new features here, but there is a huge amount of fixes and code maintenance.

Changes in this release:
* Improved launcher performance and responsiveness. I know I abuse this point a lot, but this time it actually _is_ an improvement.
* Fixed snackbar disappearing due to nonexistent favourites panel. _I'm sorry_.
* Squashed bugs from app panel and search bar.
* Fixed inconsistent UIs and UXs where possible.

Oh and the APK size grew. Nice.

name: v1.3.4.3
body:
_Now_, I wanted to delay the release a bit further, but there will be huge feature implementations after this and I'd rather not miss a milestone to go back to.

Changes:
* You can now tell the favourites panel to stop being shy: make it persistent and have it appear all the time.
* Adaptive icon shadows, based off of the feature in Launcher3.
* Some minor crash fixes.

Don't crash, k?

name: v1.3.4.2
body:
__Wow__, v1.3.4.1 was such a cluster of mess. Not only that it crashed literally everywhere, but it also broke lots of things. Let's (hopefully) fix that.

Changes:
* Fixed crashes due to ProGuard killing SlidingUpPanel class.
* Improved searching; now it should be less buggy.
* Silenced receiver log-flood.

Not a whole lot, I know, but at least it's usable.

name: v1.3.4.1
body:
Why `x.x.x.1`? Because I like milestones but like any sane person, I don't want to bump the version too much.

Changes in this small release:
* Improved fuzzy search.
* _Keyboard navigation!_ If you have a full-sized keyboard handy in your pocket (for some reason), you can now navigate the app list by using arrow keys.
* Several user experience improvements for the nitpicks.
* Minute bug fixes; things should work better, if it wasn't already.
* __Increased app size is a huge plus because support libraries are super friendly to an SDK update.__

I'm thinking of doing larger releases later, but I'm sure it's going to be another minor bump.

name: v1.3.4
body:
It's a bugfix release. It needs no introduction. Let's begin.

Changes in this release:
* Fixed crashing when a set icon pack is uninstalled.
* Favourites panel should hate you less and will glitch out less often now.
* Optimisations, optimisations. You won't see them, but it's there.
* **Speedy performance improvements or something**.

Don't worry, I'm only ironing out v1.3 for a bigger release at later date. Hopefully one that breaks less.

name: v1.3.3
body:
Oh hey, wouldn't you know it? It's a bug fix release that does something else apart from fixing bugs!

Changes in this release:
* Favourites panel has been reworked. It's now better, more responsive, and require no swipe to summon.
* Fuzzy search should now swoop in more results.
* Fixed issues regarding toolbar not showing up in ICS and Jellybean.
* Other minute improvements that you may or may not see.

Honestly, I feel like I needed to do more and I think this should have been a 'v1.3.2.1', but hey — it is what it is.

name: v1.3.2
body:
One whole week without a release feels awfully dull. Let's change that.

Changes in this release:
* Hubby Launcher is now HgLauncher! No acquisition was done, I just felt like changing the name into something less rational.
* Backup and restore. This doesn't need any explanation. It backups and restores your current configuration; be it pinned apps, hidden apps, anything in between, etc.
* Theme preferences are now applied on-the-fly. No need to open the desktop to see the sweet dark theme be applied.
* Improved hidden apps management, now you can quickly check off any apps you think should be hidden.
* The launcher now have adaptive icons. It's not that we _need_ to have them though.
* Fixes a lot of crashes, UI inconsistencies, and other such problems caused by bad codes and life decisions.
* __Bug fixes and speedy performance improvements.__

Hey, the launcher is also live on Play Store, [go check it out!](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=mono.hg)

name: v1.3.1
body:
This is a whole lot more than a bug fix release, I promise.

Changes merged and added to this release:
* Favourites panel! Pin your apps to an intuitive panel that you can summon with a swipe. You can also configure the panel position for an ease-of-use.
* General performance improvements and removed crufts bogging the code down
* Reduced APK size for that sweet-sweet storage space.
* Plenty of bug fixes. You can probably notice them at first glance, too.

Yes, this is still _technically_ a bug fix release.

name: v1.3.0.1
body: A quick fix release that should fix broken app listeners as well as erratic app list. Just ignore the previous release I made and pretend this is the actual v1.3 from now on.

name: v1.3
body:
_Finally_ a release that actually added something and isn't focused on bug fixing. Sort of.

With this release, the following changes has been merged:
* Limited icon pack support. Make your launcher less dead and dull!
* Fixed generally untrustworthy app panel; it should now be less hectic and sporadic.
* Major bug fixes. Lots of them, let me tell you that.
* User experience improvements because I don't know what else to type here.

Be ready for more bug fixes release!

name: v1.2.2
body:
Apparently v1.2.1 was a cluster of mess. Here's a token of my apology.

This release fixes the following issues:
* Unstable, broken, or generally untrustworthy app hiding. It should work better and smoother now.
* Wallpaper shade not at all shading the entire screen _for some reason_.

It also adds a few new additions:
* If you feel that the app panel is making you claustrophobic, be sure to try out the new 'comfy' padding mode. It's guaranteed to look different.
* The launcher will now refresh itself whenever it detects newly installed/removed applications. No more manually refreshing the launcher!
* Preferences/configuration changes are now applied immediately; restart not required.
* Improved user interface for hidden app management.

I feel that I'm missing something while writing this, but I don't think it's important.

name: v1.2.1
body:
Issues addressed by this release:
* Hiding app does not work unless the launcher is restarted or force closed.
* Changes made in settings does not apply immediately, requiring a complete launcher restart.
* App list is ordered wrongly, or is generally doing things that it wasn't meant to do.

Update is recommended unless you like bugs, in which case, good on you.

name: v1.2
body:
This release brings out a lot of new features and improvements, here are the few most noticeable ones:
* Completely rewritten most of the code; the app is now faster, more usable, and less incompetent.
* Minimalism-oriented design is back. The desktop is fully immersive; the only intrusion made is when you want to do something within the launcher.
* Quicker operations through gesture-based panel.
* Inline web search: the queries you type in the launcher's search bar can be used to search for online information.
* Hide unwanted apps from your list and manage them quickly through the launcher's settings.
* Go dark with the new dark gray and black theme.
* And as always: __Bug fixes and speedy performance improvements.__
